{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sensory endings are the parts of the nerve that receive and send signals to the brain. Annulospiral endings, also known as primary endings, are indeed wrapped around the central region of intrafusal muscle fibers. They are responsible for the initiation of a stretch reflex and conduct type Ia afferent fibers. Flower spray endings, also known as secondary endings, are another type of sensory ending found in muscle spindles. Therefore, all the statements seem to be correct.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
